# Geometric Invariant Theory

  • See also algebraic geometry.

# Linearisations

# GGG-linearisation

A GGG-linearisation on a line bundle LLL is an action σ‾:G×L→L\overline{\sigma}: G \times L \rightarrow Lσ:G×L→L such that

  • the diagram commutes;

  • the zero section of LLL is GGG-stable.

# Picard Groups of Products

Consider two varieties X,YX, YX,Y, and their projections p1:X×Y→Xp_{1}: X \times Y \rightarrow Xp1​:X×Y→X, p2:X×Y→Yp_{2} : X \times Y \rightarrow Yp2​:X×Y→Y. From this we ge a map

p1∗×p2∗:Pic(X)×Pic(Y)⟶Pic(X×Y),(L,M)⟼p1∗(L)⊗p2∗(M).p_{1}^{\ast} \times p_{2}^{\ast} : Pic(X) \times Pic(Y) ⟶ Pic(X \times Y),\\ (L,M) ⟼ p_{1}^{\ast}(L) \otimes p_{2}^{\ast}(M). p1∗​×p2∗​:Pic(X)×Pic(Y)⟶Pic(X×Y),(L,M)⟼p1∗​(L)⊗p2∗​(M).

This map p1∗×p2∗p_{1}^{\ast} \times p_{2}^{\ast}p1∗​×p2∗​ is an isomorphism when XXX and YYY are both normal irreducible varieties, and when one of them is rational, that is, one contains a non-empty open subset isomorphic to an open subset of some affine space An\mathbb{A}^{n}An.
